the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors.

properties.description:
At 1252 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along
a line extending from near Culbertson to 12 miles northeast of
Flowing Wells Rest Area. Movement was east at 60 mph.

HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around
unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is
possible.

Locations impacted include...
Wolf Point, Poplar, Culbertson, Circle, Brockton, Bainville, Froid,
Richey, Lambert, Vida, Nelson Creek Rec Area, Rock Creek Rec Area,
Oswego, Snowden, Fort Kipp, Homestead, Enid, Nohly, Sprole, and
Mccabe.
properties.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

properties.areaDesc: Suwannee; Baker; Inland Nassau; Union; Bradford; Inland St. Johns; Gilchrist; Inland Flagler; Eastern Hamilton; Coastal Nassau; Coastal Duval; Eastern Clay; Coastal St. Johns; Eastern Putnam; Coastal Flagler; Western Hamilton; Trout River; Western Clay; Northern Columbia; South Central Duval; Southeastern Columbia; Western Duval; Southwestern Columbia
properties.headline: Heat Advisory issued June 24 at 2:34AM EDT until June 24 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville FL
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heat index values up to 109 expected.

* WHERE...Portions of northeast and northern Florida.

* WHEN...From 1 PM this afternoon to 7 PM EDT this evening.

* IMPACTS...Hot temperatures and high humidity may cause heat
illnesses.
properties.instruction:
Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of
the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors.

Take extra precautions when outside. Wear lightweight and loose
fitting clothing. Try to limit strenuous activities to early morning
or evening. Take action when you see symptoms of heat exhaustion and
heat stroke.

To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and
Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in
shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat
should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an
emergency! Call 9 1 1.

NWSheadline: HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING

properties.areaDesc: North Walton; Central Walton; Holmes; Washington; Jackson; Inland Bay; Calhoun; Inland Gulf; Inland Franklin; Gadsden; Leon; Inland Jefferson; Madison; Liberty; Inland Wakulla; Inland Taylor; Lafayette; Inland Dixie; South Walton; Coastal Bay; Coastal Gulf; Coastal Franklin; Coastal Wakulla
properties.headline: Heat Advisory issued June 24 at 1:31AM CDT until June 24 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee FL
properties.description:
* WHAT...Heat index values up to 110 expected.

* WHERE...Portions of the Big Bend and the Panhandle of Florida.

* WHEN...From 11 AM CDT /noon EDT/ this morning to 6 PM CDT /7 PM
EDT/ this evening.

* IMPACTS...Hot temperatures and high humidity may cause heat
illnesses.
properties.instruction:
Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of
the sunshine, and check up on relatives and neighbors.

Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When
possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or
evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat
stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible.

NWSheadline: HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM CDT /NOON EDT/ THIS MORNING TO 6 PM CDT /7 PM EDT/ THIS EVENING

properties.areaDesc: Burke, ND
properties.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 24 at 1:26AM CDT until June 24 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Bismarck ND
properties.description:
SVRBIS

The National Weather Service in Bismarck has issued a

* Severe Thunderstorm Warning for...
Northeastern Burke County in northwestern North Dakota...

* Until 200 AM CDT.

* At 125 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles east of
Flaxton, or 42 miles north of Stanley, moving southeast at 35 mph.

HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail
damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect
wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees.

* Locations impacted include...
Bowbells, Flaxton, Northgate, and Coteau.
properties.instruction:
For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a
building.

properties.areaDesc: McCone, MT; Richland, MT; Roosevelt, MT
properties.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 24 at 12:26AM MDT until June 24 at 1:15AM MDT by NWS Glasgow MT
properties.description:
SVRGGW

The National Weather Service in Glasgow has issued a

* Severe Thunderstorm Warning for...
Central Roosevelt County in northeastern Montana...
Northeastern McCone County in northeastern Montana...
Northwestern Richland County in northeastern Montana...

* Until 115 AM MDT.

* At 1225 AM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Poplar,
moving east at 35 mph.

HAZARD...Quarter size hail.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected.

* Locations impacted include...
Poplar, Culbertson, Brockton, Sprole, and Fort Kipp.
properties.instruction:
Prepare immediately for large hail and deadly cloud to ground
lightning. Seek shelter inside a well-built structure. Stay away from
windows.

SVRBIS

* Severe Thunderstorm Warning for...
Northwestern Ward County in north central North Dakota...
Western Bottineau County in north central North Dakota...
Renville County in north central North Dakota...
Northeastern Burke County in northwestern North Dakota...

* Until 215 AM CDT.

* At 108 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 11 miles west of
Sherwood, or 49 miles northeast of Stanley, moving southeast at 45
mph.

HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail
damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect
considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to
mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings.

* Locations impacted include...
Kenmare, Mohall, Westhope, Lansford, Sherwood, Greene, Maxbass,
Antler, Tolley, Norma, Loraine, Grano, Niobe, and Eckman.
properties.instruction:
For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a
building.

properties.areaDesc: Chesapeake Bay from New Point Comfort to Little Creek VA; Chesapeake Bay from Little Creek VA to Cape Henry VA including the Chesapeake Bay Bridge Tunnel; James River from James River Bridge to Hampton Roads Bridge-Tunnel
properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued June 24 at 2:04AM EDT until June 24 at 3:15AM EDT by NWS Wakefield VA
properties.description:
SMWAKQ

The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a

* Special Marine Warning for...
Chesapeake Bay from Little Creek VA to Cape Henry VA including the
Chesapeake Bay Bridge Tunnel...
Chesapeake Bay from New Point Comfort to Little Creek VA...
James River from James River Bridge to Hampton Roads
Bridge-Tunnel...

* Until 315 AM EDT.

* At 203 AM EDT, thunderstorms were located along a line extending
from Poquoson to 12 nm south of Burwell Bay, moving east at 20
knots.

HAZARD...Wind gusts 34 knots or greater.

SOURCE...Radar.

IMPACT...Small craft could be damaged in briefly higher winds and
suddenly higher waves.

* Locations impacted include...
Chesapeake Bay Bridge Tunnel, Thimble Shoals, Tue Marshes Light,
Hampton Flats, The Hump, Willoughby Bay, Sewells Point, Cabbage
Patch, Cape Charles Harbor, 1st Island Bay Bridge, Latimer Shoal,
Plantation Light, Poquoson, Dominion Pier, Kiptopeke Concrete
Ships, Hampton Roads Bridge Tunnel, Lynnhaven, York Spit Reef, Buoy
36a, and Hampton River Inlet.
properties.instruction:
Move to safe harbor until hazardous weather passes. These
thunderstorms are weakening but still are capable of producing
strong wind gusts.

properties.description:

portions of the tidal Potomac River from Key Bridge to Cobb Island

should exercise caution and be prepared for locally higher winds
and waves.

properties.areaDesc: Waters from Manasquan Inlet NJ to Little Egg Inlet NJ out 20 to 40 nm; Waters from Little Egg Inlet NJ to Great Egg Inlet NJ out 20 to 40 nm from 20 to 40 NM
properties.headline: Special Marine Warning issued June 24 at 1:14AM EDT until June 24 at 2:15AM EDT by NWS Mount Holly NJ
properties.description:
SMWPHI

The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a

* Special Marine Warning for...
Outer waters from Manasquan Inlet to Great Egg Inlet NJ out 20 to
40 nm...

* Until 215 AM EDT.

* At 113 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing
waterspouts was located 21 nm southeast of Garden State South Reef,
moving east at 35 knots.

HAZARD...Waterspouts and wind gusts 34 knots or greater.

SOURCE...Radar.

IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally
hazardous seas. Small craft could be damaged in briefly
higher winds and suddenly higher waves.

* The severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly open waters.
properties.instruction: Move to safe harbor until hazardous weather passes.
